page.title: 10Easington village green
page.content: On Easinton village green there is amilestone and it says Houghton Le Spring 7 miles. Near the milestone are two sycamore trees. They were put there in 1897 because Queen Victoria was Queen for 60 years and had her diamond jubilee. There is a flat stone, some say it is an old well and some say it is there for people to get on their horses. At the top near the church is the form seat. It was made by John and Andrew Delanoy's great great grandad in 1897. There are 3 shops on the village green and 5 pubs. The shops are a newsagent a butcher and a fish and chip shop. The pubs are the Masons Arms, The Kings Head, The Shoulder of Mutton, The Village Inn and Southside Social Club. A new bus shelter has been built after pressure from the parish council.
